page.title: 04China Clay Production
page.content: The Blackpool China Clay Works is a key area in the production of China Clay from central Cornwall. It is the third largest pit out of the 21 pits within the group and produces over 7,500 tonnes of speciality clay each week. Most of this clay is used by the Paper Industry, both as a Filler and as a Coating Clay. There are 49 people employed at the Blackpool China Clay Pit and 46 at the associated Refining Plant. The nearby Blackpool Slurry Plant employs 46 to produce around 1,652 tonnes of high quality Coating Pigment each week. At the Burngullow Tube Press, Dry Clay Filler is produced at the rate of 2800 tonnes per week with a workforce of 17 people. The debris ratio is around 7 tonnes of waste material for each tonne of useful product. The waste is dumped at Blackpool Tip. (Mike Yates)
